intro: Campanula glomerata var. dahurica, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Europe and western Asia. It features upright stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, oval-shaped leaves with toothed margins. It thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
